result.execSummary:
The defendant David K Hall, was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$5000 - $10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant David K Hall in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Lawton special for today. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, objected to a stay of sentence. There is no indication of an appeal being done. Atty. Lawton stated he filed a notice of intent to file appeal. Defendant made statement, requested 30-90 day stay. Court denied motion for a stay or furlough. Further statement by defendant. Motion denied.
from defendant regarding stay of sentence, representation and cash bond.

1:49 P.M., Defendant David K Hall in court, in custody with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentenced defendant to:  3 years prison, 18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision, Restitution to be paid as condition of incarceration and extended supervision, prohibits defendant to be self employed and take prepayment for services or labor, not to be in control of anyone else's money, 103 days sentence credit, fine/costs to be converted into civil judgment, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance, 2:18 P.M.

Defendant appeared by video from Columbia County Jail.  Defendant not eligible from Public Defenders' Office as owns house.  Defendant requested Atty Lawton be reappointed.  Atty Lawton is agreeable.  Court questions defendant on repayment of attorney costs from case before disposition.  Defendant thought all payments went to restitution first.  Defendant intends to sell house to pay financial obligations.  Court ordered defendant to pay $50/month -already set up on payment plan.

Defendant David K Hall in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by ADA Cross. Defendant has not paid restitution in full. Victim made a statement. Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years. Conditions of probation include: restitution plus surcharge, $518.00 costs, submit DNA sample. 1 day jail credit. Defendant has paid $3000.00 towards restitution prior today. If there are no new charges and restitution is paid in full, State would not object to defendants request for early discharge from probation after one full year, if DOC agrees.   9:09/9:29
